Comment: Matveeva decides against the Classical response.
Very conservative. The usual reply is to advance this Pawn TWO squares and form an ideal center.
Because of the timid second move, 3 N-QB3 is no longer possible, as 3... P-Q5 would drive the Knight from its post.
Matveeva develops the Knight to its natural square.
Matveeva develops aggressively, in contrast to Shafranska's overly timid approach.
I'm guessing this was intended as a prelude to fianchettoing the KB. However, it weakens the pinned Knight by depriving it of Pawn protection.
Matveeva exploits the error by adding pressure to the helpless Knight.
...this move now wins a piece. Shafranska resigns.
